intro: Malesherbia lanceolata, commonly known as the slender malesherbia, is a perennial shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
